JUSTICE P.B.SURESH KUMAR MONDAY, THE O6TH DAY OF JANUARY 2020 / 16TH POUSHA, 1941 Cr1.MC.No.9258 OF 2019(F) AGAINST THE ORDER IN CC NO.583/2015 OF JUDICIAL MAGISTRATE OF FIRST CLASS -II, KANJIRAPPALLY CRIME NO.830/2015 OF PONKUNNAM POLICE STATION, KOTTAYAM PETITIONERS/ACCUSED 1 TO 12: 1 JINS JOSE, AGED 32 YEARS, S/O.ANNAMMA JOSEPH, 12/77, AKKARAYIL, CHENGALAM. 2 BABU MATHEW, AGED 62 YEARS, S/O.THOMAS MATHEW, KOCHUPARAMBIL, KOPRAKALAM, NARIANANI.P.O., KANJIRAPPALLY . 3 RATHEESH MOHAN, AGED 36 YEARS, S/O.C.N.MOHANAN NAIR, VEETTIYANKAL, THEKKETHUKAVALA, CHIRAKKADAVU, KOTTAYAM. 4 BENNY CHACKO, AGED 50 YEARS, S/O.CHACKO, VEZHAMBASSERIL (H), VANCHIMALA.P.O., ELAMGULAM VILLAGE, ELIKKULAM, KOTTAYAM . 5 V.C.BABY, AGED 57 YEARS, S/O.CHACKO, VEZHAMBASSERIL (H), VANCHIMALA.P.O., ELAMGULAM VILLAGE, ELIKKULAM, KOTTAYAM. 6 EPPACHAN ANTONY, AGED 57 YEARS, S/O.ANTONY, VEZHAMBASSERIL, KOORALI, ELAMGULAM.P.O., KOTTAYAM. BY ADV. SRI.I.DINESH MENON RESPONDENTS /COMPLAINT : 1 VARKEY GEORGE, AGED 59 YEARS, S/O.VARKEY, CHERIPURATH HOUSE, KOORALI, ELANKULAM, KOTTAYAM-686522. 2 GRACYKUTTY, AGED 57 YEARS, W/O.VARKEY GEORGE, CHERIPURATH HOUSE, KOORALI, ELANKULAM, KOTTAYAM- 686522. Baan = . il iat 2020/KER/258 Crl.M.C.No.9258 of 2019 3 3 STATE OF KERALA, REPRESENTED BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM-682031, THROUGH SUB INSPECTOR OF POLICE, PONKUNNAM POLICE STATION, KOTTAYAM DISTRICT-686506. R1-2 BY ADV. L.RAJESH NARAYAN SRI. TR.RENJITH PP THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING BEEN FINALLY HEARD ON 06.01.2020, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING : [BlSene 2020/KER/258 Crl.M.C.No.9258 of 2019 4 Cri.M.C. No.9258 of 2019 ORDER This is a proceedings instituted under Section 482 of the Code of Criminal Procedure for quashing Annexure A2 final report and all further proceedings pursuant thereto, now pending as C.C.No.583 of 2015 on the files of the Court of the Judicial Magistrate of First Class - Il, Kanjirappally against the petitioners. 2. The petitioners are accused Nos.1 to 12 in the said case. The case was one instituted at the instance of respondents 1 and 2 under Sections 143, 149, 427, 447 and 506 (ii) of the Indian Penal Code. 3. It is seen that the petitioners and respondents 1 and 2 have settled their disputes, and affidavits to that effect have been filed by respondents 1 and 2 as Annexure A3 series to the effect that they do not intend to pursue the matter further. 4. The learned counsel for respondents 1 and 2 affirms that Annexure A3 series affidavits are affidavits sworn Pelee aed _ Skat 2020/KER/258 Crl.M.C.No.9258 of 2019 5 to by respondents 1 and 2, and submits that they have no objection in granting the relief sought for by the petitioners. 5. In the light of the decisions of the Apex Court in Gian singh v. State of Punjab, (2012) 10 SCC 303 and Narinder singh v. State of Punjab, (2014) 6 SCC 466, | am of the view that this is an appropriate case where this court has to invoke the jurisdiction under Section 482 of the Code of Criminal Procedure to quash the proceedings against the petitioners. In the result, the Crl.M.C. Is allowed and Annexure A2 final report and all further proceedings pursuant thereto against the petitioners, pending as C.C.No.583 of 2015 on the files of the Court of the Judicial Magistrate of First Class - Il, Kanjirappally are quashed. Sd/- P.B.SURESH KUMAR, JUDGE. YKB Blan ee ce i iy 2020/KER/258 Crl.M.C.No.9258 of 2019 6 APPENDIX PETITIONER'S/S EXHIBITS: ANNEXURE Al TRUE COPY OF THE FIR NO.830/2015 DATED 6.7.2015. ANNEXURE A2 TRUE COPY OF THE FINAL REPORT DATED 23.10.2017. ANNEXURE A3 TRUE COPY OF THE AFFIDAVIT DATED 12.12.2019. RESPONDENT'S/S EXHIBITS: NIL //TRUE coPpy// PA TO JUDGE
